intro: Pentaptilon careyi, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Pentaptilon careyi thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous forest areas.
